[[Image:The Tor Pin.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of the Tor on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''The Tor''' is a castle in [[Dorne]], the region of [[Westeros]] that is controlled byÂ [[House Martell]] of [[Sunspear]]. The castle is located in the north of Dorne on the shore of the [[Sea of Dorne]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/dorne/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Dorne entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the Tor is the seat of House Jordayne, one of the most powerful Dornish houses.

In the novels, [[George R.R. Martin]] named this castle and its house as a tribute to fellow fantasy author [[wikipedia:Robert Jordan|Robert Jordan]], author of the ''[[wikipedia:The Wheel of Time|Wheel of Time]]'' series. Tor Books are the publishers of the ''Wheel of Time'' books and the head of House Jordayne is Lord Trebor (a palindrome of 'Robert').
